page.title: 15A Watford Dad's day at work.
page.content: Dad is a printer and he works at Croxley Mill just outside Watford. Watford has been famous for printing but ODHAMS has closed and part of SUN printers may close soon and they were the two main companies. Dad does shift work. When he does a day shift he works from 5.00am until 6.30pm while night shifts are 5.30pm until 5.30am. His job at the mill is to cut the paper. He lifts and feeds the paper into the cutting machine and it comes out the right sizes at the other end ready to be stacked. The machinery is electric and can be dangerous. Once a man went through the machine and was killed. Many of the paper mills owned by DRG have closed in the last 5 years. Many of them used to get all their raw material by canal and send away their finished product in the same way.
